            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Polycyclic aromatic compounds (PACs) are a geographically widespread group of hydrocarbon chemicals, present in the environment as complex mixtures. During the past 25 years, levels of PACs in some northern ecosystems have been increasing, particularly in water, sediments, and lower trophic level organisms. However, relatively little information is publicly available to evaluate PACs in aquatic systems in the Sahtú Settlement Area. To help fill this knowledge gap, this project has two purposes: (i) to evaluate levels, composition, and potential biological impacts of PACs in water bodies in the Northwest Territories and (ii) to help make associated data more accessible to Indigenous communities, as well as to regulators who make decisions about water permits. SPMDs were deployed for approximately a month at a time in waterbodies in the Sahtú Settlement Area.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-b698-cd20
notes: Polycyclic aromatic compounds (PACs) are a geographically widespread group of hydrocarbon chemicals, present in the environment as complex mixtures. During the past 25 years, levels of PACs in some northern ecosystems have been increasing, particularly in water, sediments, and lower trophic level organisms. However, relatively little information is publicly available to evaluate PACs in aquatic systems in the Sahtú Settlement Area. To help fill this knowledge gap, this project has two purposes: (i) to evaluate levels, composition, and potential biological impacts of PACs in water bodies in the Northwest Territories and (ii) to help make associated data more accessible to Indigenous communities, as well as to regulators who make decisions about water permits. SPMDs were deployed for approximately a month at a time in waterbodies in the Sahtú Settlement Area.

notes_translated.en: Polycyclic aromatic compounds (PACs) are a geographically widespread group of hydrocarbon chemicals, present in the environment as complex mixtures. During the past 25 years, levels of PACs in some northern ecosystems have been increasing, particularly in water, sediments, and lower trophic level organisms. However, relatively little information is publicly available to evaluate PACs in aquatic systems in the Sahtú Settlement Area. To help fill this knowledge gap, this project has two purposes: (i) to evaluate levels, composition, and potential biological impacts of PACs in water bodies in the Northwest Territories and (ii) to help make associated data more accessible to Indigenous communities, as well as to regulators who make decisions about water permits. SPMDs were deployed for approximately a month at a time in waterbodies in the Sahtú Settlement Area.
notes_translated.fr: Les composés aromatiques polycycliques (PAC) constituent un groupe géographiquement répandu de produits chimiques hydrocarbonés, présents dans l'environnement sous forme de mélanges complexes. Au cours des 25 dernières années, les niveaux de PAC ont augmenté dans certains écosystèmes nordiques, en particulier dans l'eau, les sédiments et les organismes des niveaux trophiques inférieurs. Cependant, relativement peu d'informations sont accessibles au public pour évaluer les PAC dans les systèmes aquatiques de la zone de peuplement de Sahtú. Pour aider à combler cette lacune dans les connaissances, ce projet a deux objectifs : (i) évaluer les niveaux, la composition et les impacts biologiques potentiels des PAC dans les plans d'eau des Territoires du Nord-Ouest et (ii) aider à rendre les données connexes plus accessibles aux communautés autochtones, ainsi qu'aux organismes de réglementation qui prennent des décisions concernant les permis d'utilisation de l'eau. Des SPMD ont été déployés pendant environ un mois d'affilée dans les plans d'eau de la zone de peuplement de Sahtú.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: CIMP 216: Hydrocarbon-derived compounds (anthropogenic and natural) in water bodies in the Sahtu. NWT-Wide Community based Water Quality Monitoring Program

title_translated.fr: CIMP 216 : Composés dérivés des hydrocarbures (anthropiques et naturels) dans les plans d'eau du Sahtu. Programme communautaire de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau à l'échelle des Territoires du Nord-Ouest
